column4: ok, i've installed the ATI binary drivers following the docs, but fglrxinfo still isn't reporting my OpenGL renderer or vendor strings as ATI; they are Mesa something... my resolution is now correct, but i'm still getting the same image on both displays
you're trying to help me get both displays working as one big desktop instead of 2 identical desktops =)
Ohh, then use a photocopier and scotch tape, your refresh rate would be like 1 every 10 minutes, but hey.... its Ubuntu you know
